title: Meet the Senior Nomads: 160 cities, 56 countries : Travel, News - India Today
text:
The Senior Nomads. Picture courtesy: Instagram/seniornomads 
"I love to travel" has become a very common sentence of late, don't you think? 
Now, think about leaving behind all your worldly possessions and living just out of a backpack, only to fulfill your wildest globetrotting fantasies. How many of us can actually muster up the courage to do it? 
Meet this retired couple from Seattle who gave up everything they earned just for the love of travel. Debbie and Michael Campbell call themselves Senior Nomads, who literally sold off everything, even their house, to realise that 'one more adventure' of exploring the entire world. Senior Nomads in Cuba. Picture courtesy: Instagram/seniornomads 
Also Read:First Indian woman to drive solo to the coldest inhabited place on earth, Nidhi Tiwari, talks about her journey 
The couple started their journey in 2013 and has so far travelled across more than 160 cities and 56 countries, including all of Europe, as well as Morocco, Russia, Turkey, Israel, Mexico and Cuba. 
If you think that's too expensive an affair, the Campbells have a solution for that too. For the past three years of wandering around the world, the couple has only known Airbnbs as their home. Picture courtesy: Instagram/seniornomads 
In the course of their travel, the Senior Nomads have also been sharing their inspirational story with a lot of travel enthusiasts. The couple has now come up with a book titled Your Keys, Our Home, where they recount their amazing travel experiences all across the globe. 
And how they summarise their experience is warm enough, especially at a time when the world is undergoing heavy international crisis. This is what they say, "From the barber's chair in Dublin and the dentist's chair in Split, to a wild motorcycle ride in Athens, a peek behind the Soviet curtain in Transnistria and the demise of a chicken for dinner in Marrakech, we found the world to be just one big neighborhood."
